DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate practice short term maternal perinatal outcome trial labor cesarean section offer woman Ain Shams University Maternity Hospital ( ASUMH ) 3-year period January 2013 December 2015 .
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation Trials Labor After Previous Cesarean Section Ain Shams University Maternity Hospital
DOC.detailed_description: This retrospective study perform Ain Shams University Maternity Hospital . The follow data gather ( whenever available ) , tabulate subject proper statistical analysis : History : - Age - Duration marriage - Inter-pregnancy interval - Gestational age ( menstrual date US ) - Obstetric history ( parity , mode delivery , assist vaginal delivery , previous vaginal birth cesarean section , neonatal outcome ) - Present past history medical , surgical obstetric problem ; history infection previous CS General examination : - General condition - Vital data Abdominal examination : - Fundal level - Estimated fetal weight ( clinically US ) - Scar tenderness Vaginal examination admission : - Cervical status - Station present part - Membranes status - Pelvic adequacy Investigations perform : - Complete Blood Count - Ultrasonography Intrapartum management : - Progress duration labor accord partogram ( admission-delivery time ) - Intrapartum complication ; placental abruption , uterine rupture , hysterectomy , complication surgical intervention Mode delivery : - Vaginal delivery ( spontaneous , assist , complication ) - Cesarean section ( indication , scar dehiscence ) Postpartum Data : - Postpartum hemorrhage - Blood transfusion - Neonatal outcome ; fetal weight , birth trauma , Neonatal Intensive Care Unit admission , mortality
DOC.criteria: Women admit labour One prior caesarean section Singleton pregnancy Vertexpresenting fetus Prior highrisk uterine scar ; uterine rupture , classical CS , hysterotomy myomectomy Short interdelivery interval ( < 12 month ) Complications previous CS ( e.g . puerperal sepsis ) Obstetric indication CS ( either elective emergency ) : Placenta praevia Placental abruption Documented evidence cephalopelvic disproportion Fetal macrosomia ( estimate fetal weight > 4 kg ) Fetal anomalies interfere vaginal delivery e.g . hydrocephalus Fetal distress nonreassuring Cardiotocography pattern
